intro: Paris fargesii var. latipetala, commonly known as the broad-petaled Paris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant features delicate, arrow-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers in early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
